Material Anatomical Entity (UBERON:0000465)
(allow more than one, e.g. bone + marrow?)
Create a BFO site for this?

column3:
Replaces http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ERO_0001334.  Definition: "Specimen creation of a sample of tissue from a living body for diagnostic purposes." . 

Super-class: "specimen collection from organism"
column5: A specimen collection that obtains a sample of tissue from a living multicellular organism body for diagnostic purposes by means intended to be minimally invasive.
column11: Biopsy of a potentially cancerous mole.

column3:
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/OMIT_0027992

http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C15652
(NCIT has 4+ subclasses)
 - such as X-ray, computerized tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or ultrasound -
column5: A biopsy which uses an imaging procedure to guide a needle biopsy.
column10: image-guided biopsy|imaging guided biopsy|image guided needle biopsy
column11: Image-guided needle biopsy allows a doctor to biopsy suspicious areas that aren't readily seen or felt through skin, such as in a prostate gland.

column3:
http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C137909

https://www.cancer.gov/publications/dictionaries/cancer-terms/def/ct-guided-biopsy

Biopsy of tissue using computed tomography as an aid in directing a biopsy needle into the area of interest. http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C137909
column5: A needle biopsy guided by real-time computed tomography (CT) scan images.
column10: Computed Tomography Assisted Biopsy|CT Guided Biopsy|CT Assisted Biopsy|Computed Tomography-Guided Needle Biopsy
column11: A CT Guided Biopsy is a procedure performed by a radiologist to obtain a small tissue sample through a needle.

column5: A needle biopsy guided by ultrasound visualization.
column11: An ultrasound-guided needle biopsy uses sound waves to help locate a nodule or abnormality within the thyroid.

column5: A biopsy that uses a hollow needle to extract cells.
column11: A needle biopsy is often used on suspicious breast lumps and enlarged lymph nodes that a doctor can feel through a patient's skin.

column5: A biopsy that uses a thin needle to extract cells.
column11: A fine needle aspiration biopsy is commonly performed in order to test for cancer.
column13: Chris Stoeckert, Helena Ellis, Jie Zheng

column5: A biopsy that uses a hollow tube to collect a core of tissue.
column11: A core needle biopsy can remove more tissue than a fine needle biopsy, and therefore can provide more information about the cells and tissue removed.
column13: Chris Stoeckert, Helena Ellis, Jie Zheng

column5: A biopsy involving a surgical incision into an organism to access the biopsy material.
column11: Surgical biopsy may be required to collect hard-to-reach tissue.

column3: OBI:0002658 will be used if a valid distinction can be made between the two children of 'surgical biopsy'
column5: A biopsy involving the collection of a portion of abnormal tissue without attempting to remove the entire lesion or tumor.

column3: OBI:0002659 will be used if a valid distinction can be made between the two children of 'surgical biopsy'
column5: A biopsy involving the collection of an entire lump or suspicious area.
A biopsy involving the collection of a small part of the abdominal wall fat pad.
column11: The makeup of fat in the abdominal wall can be investigated by fat biopsy.

column5: A biopsy involving the collection of the tip of a mamallian tail.
column11: A mouse tail biopsy was performed to collect material for DNA extraction.

column5: A biopsy where a small amount of bone and a small amount of fluid and bone marrow are collected.
column11: A bone marrow biopsy removes bone with the marrow inside to look at under a microscope

column5: A biopsy that involves the collection of a cylinder of skin (including epidermis, dermis and superficial fat) using a punch tool.
column11: A three or four millimeter punch is used in s skinpunch biopsy proceedure.

column5: A biopsy performed with a needle augmented with a vacuum device.
column11: A vacuum assisted biopsy can remove an area of abnormal cells from breast tissue.
